title: Pride of Britain Awards: Kym Marsh cuts a glamorous figure as she walks the red carpet
text:
She has been busy filming her final scenes for Coronation Street as she prepares to depart the soap.

And Kym Marsh looked nothing short of sensational as she attended the Pride of Britain Awards held at the Grosvenor House Hotel in London on Monday.

The actress, 43, cut a stylish figure as she donned a black sleeveless dress with a daring leg slit.

Radiant: Kym Marsh, 43, looked nothing short of sensational as she attended the Pride of Britain Awards held at the Grosvenor House Hotel in London on Monday

The garment also featured a structured right shoulder along with a shimmering sequined embellishment.

Kym added height to her frame with a pair of black heels with ankle straps while she also carried a black clutch bag.

The soap star also sported glittering silver earrings and a matching bracelet for the evening while she styled her brunette locks into a ponytail.

Kym's outing comes after she shared a heartfelt tribute to her late son Archie as she marked this year's Baby Loss Awareness Week.

Glamour: The actress cut a stylish figure as she donned a black sleeveless dress with a daring leg slit

She and ex-husband Jamie Lomas were left heartbroken when their child passed away at just 21 weeks, following a premature birth in February 2009.

The soap star uploaded a snap of a personalised candle and a framed picture of Archie's footprints to her Instagram account, where she revealed her 'heart remains broken' following his tragic death.

The former Hear'Say star captioned the post: 'Today we remember all of those babies who became angels far too soon, and all of the parents whose hearts remain broken. I am one of those parents.

Fashion: The garment also featured a structured right shoulder along with a shimmering sequined embellishment

'I am a mummy to an angel baby and I am forever grateful to have had him in my life no matter how short a time. Let’s stand together, lift the taboo and break the silence of babyloss. Sending love to all ❤️❤️ #babylossawarenessday', she penned.

Kym is mother to 23-year-old David and 22-year-old Emilie with former partner Dave Cunliffe, as well as Polly, seven, with ex Jamie, 44.

The brunette previously revealed she was in 'floods of tears' when it was revealed her grandson son Teddy Archie David Hoszowskyj, five months, was named after her late son.

Outfit: Kym added height to her frame with a pair of black heels with ankle straps while she also carried a black clutch bag

Reflecting on life after Archie, Kym explained on Lorraine last year: 'Archie is still part of the family. We celebrate his birthday every year, we send balloons up at Christmas and New Year's for him.'

Kym has been dating Scott Ratfliffe, 32, since July last year, following her split from Matt Baker, who she had been dating for two years.

Now that she's leaving Corrie, Kym has revealed that she plans to spend more time with Scott, who is a major in the Parachute Regiment and often on his base in the south of England.

The couple were introduced by her co-star Anthony Cotton, with the pair building their relationship by talking for hours at a time via FaceTime and texting, before finally coming face-to-face three weeks later.

Heartfelt: Kym recently shared a tribute to her late son Archie as she marked this year's Baby Loss Awareness Week

'My heart remains broken': She posted a snap of a personalised candle and a framed picture of Archie's footprints to her Instagram account

Earlier this year, Kym told The Sun's Fabulous magazine that she dislikes her partner being branded her 'toyboy', insisting that the term is 'insulting' to him.

More than 100 of the UK's biggest stars will come together at the Daily Mirror Pride of Britain Awards to honour the nation's unsung heroes on the landmark 20th anniversary of the event.

The awards recognise and celebrate ordinary people up and down the country doing extraordinary things.

Hosted by Carol Vorderman, celebrities and public figures including Prince Charles, Robert Downey Jr, Sir Ben Kingsley, Dua Lipa, Ant & Dec, Chris Pratt, Michael Sheen, Adam Lambert, Christine Lampard, Sir Michael Caine, Jonathan Ross, Suranne Jones, and the judges and casts of Strictly Come Dancing and X Factor will be honouring this year's awe-inspiring winners.

Carol Vorderman said: 'Pride of Britain is such a huge part of my life, it's hard to believe it's 20 years since we first started. In that time, it has found a place at the heart of British life, and the winners represent the very best of us. I never fail to be humbled by them, and this year's are no different.'

The Daily Mirror Pride of Britain Awards, in partnership with TSB, will be broadcast on ITV on 5th November at 8pm.
